review: this place was horrible, here is the list: -host does not acknowledge you. -menu he was pretending to clean was not clean- it was sticky AND gritty, which is a strange combination -Waitress Team did not work out, I guess each of them thought someone else was serving me.  Neither waitress was good and neither asked how I was doing.  All I got out of them was excuses.  Really, the first waitress says, "High Im XXX, I got caught making a desert and didnt have time to come over here."  What I heard was YOU suck and all these other people are eating and well, Ill get to  you when I can. -Brocoli was gritty, same stuff from the menus????  not sure -basically I got tired of asking for stuff  AND no, I did not even complain, I did not ask for anything other than onions on my chili and  hot sauce.  Ill let you guess how that went. Im a big fan of Brinker (chilis owner), work with a lot of them, but this restaurant was the worst Ive been to.

We must've gotten the same waitresses as the other reviewer.  Very poor service.  Beginning with the male hostess who was overwhelmed and not managing the greeting area well.  He looked for "back-ups" which he didn't get.  Only 5 pm and the restaurant side was virtually empty.  Three-four waitresses stood near the kitchen alcove doing nothing, even though tables needed to be cleared. We asked for bar booth seating (where chips & salsa are free--you pay for them on the restaurant side).  While we're waiting to be seated by him, a couple strolls past the hostess and takes the available booth!  He does nothing.  A second booth becomes available but is piled high with dirty dishes.  No waitress cleans it.  The hostess attempts to start.  A second group of customers swishes by us and attempts to take it.  We have to stand squished in between the bar and the booth for over five minutes before a waitress cleans it.  Then three come out.  They don't bother to clean the wet seat, we do it ourselves.  Finally seated, many waitresses standing around. Long time to get our drink order.  Service continues like this throughout the meal so will proceed to food review. Delicious!  The chips are thin, dry and crunchy and go great with the bitey salsa. The $5 Queso sauce is gritty and salty, not as good as we remembered.  Old Timer burger is one of the finest anywhere (too bad the ketchup on the table was out and it took forever to get a second).  Jalapeno bacon burger got rave reviews.  Mushroom swiss burger with blue cheese added got rave reviews. Chicken alfredo got rave reviews tho' way too much food.  French fries were yummy (minus ketchup).  Food took a longer time to arrive than usual.  The din in the bar was horrific between the shouters and music (which was so loud you couldn't hear it if you know what I mean).   Waitress didn't know what to do when we did NOT want the free second beer that comes with happy hour.  Diet Coke appeared watered down or flat.  Not enough napkins but we got up and grabbed from the bar as needed.  Avoided dessert and one more wait.  Their loss.  $55 plus tip to feed four of us is pretty decent but it reflected an $8 overcharge.  We just paid it. This place is in a great location for frequent visits but service has to improve to make this an enjoyable dining experience.  Where's management?

Of the Chilis in the Lakeland aea (98North, Winter Haven and this one), this one was really off.  Service terrible - makes you wonder why the workers are there.  Food wasn't up to Chili's standards.  Not going back to that one even tho' it's the closest to Polk City.

We had a great lunch.  Food fresh, very attentive service.  they seated us very quickly.  even asked me if I wanted to reheat my chili because i let it get cold from talking so much.   Not bad at all.
Good attentive service, fair food. Steak fajitas were good but not much steak. Margarita Chicken was way spicy and that sort of pressed chicken. Decent but not great.

Good experience at this location. Make sure you sit in Andrea's section. Best waitress at this location. She hooked us up and let us order off of the M - F lunch menu even though it was Saturday. Food was good. Consistent with all the other Chili's I have been to.

Lots of disappointment at this location. Greasy stale chips, soggy eggrolls and for some reason they don't know the difference between boneless and bone in wings. 4 out of 5 times they have screwed up on my wing orders. Servers have never given me problems about correcting orders and managers have made appearances to personally apologize. Food positives: Tilapia dishes, spicy chicken sausage soup(discontinued) and old timer burgers( if they cook it to your specification)

Decided to give them another chance.  After standing there waiting for the hostess to finish with her cell phone, she finally waited on us.  Despite having 7 empty tables in an entire section we were told it would be a 20 minute wait. When asked why with all the empty tables we were told the kitchen was backed up. Ok there are only so many tables, you can only have so many orders, so you can't really get unexpectedly busy, but even so if I have to wait i would rather sit at a table with drinks and chips versus outside for 20 minutes.  This is the same hostess as last time the elderly lady with gray hair. She is literally the worst hostess ever.

We walked in to a nearly empty restaurant mid afternoon with a group of about forty after a high school baseball game.  We were treated as unwelcome intruders with the server dictating how we had to sit in groups that wanted to share a check, etc. This woman definitely had an attitude. We were ready to take our business  elsewhere when server Vickie asked how she could help and said she would be happy to serve our group in a manner that we found most convenient. We agreed to stay with the understanding that we would not encounter the uncooperative server again. Vickie, Torme and a couple of other ladies did a wonderful job and were friendly. When we voiced our concerns with the manager he made the standard apology but defended the rude server saying she reacted that way because there was only one server on duty. Not sure where all the others came from suddenly? He also suggested in the future we call ahead when bringing a large group. I can see how that would help a day or even a few hours in advance, but that just isn't practical when participating in a youth sporting tournament. This manager and the rude server didn't seem to appreciate the fact that we just provided a much better revenue day and generous tips. Will avoid going there in the future. The only reason I gave three stars was for Vickie and other helpful employees. Food was typical for chain restaurant.

Save yourselves the trouble and go to the Taco Bell next door. For $60 less you can feed a family of four and your food will be hot and fresh and without a wait. Take the money you saved and buy a clue for the hostess at Chili's.
The service is very poor.  So slow, have been there a few times and it never changes.  Food is ok, usually warm not jot when it gets to you
Unwelcoming place that needs to update some of its employees to a friendlier generation.  Food was ok though.

I've never in my life been in a restaurant where I felt so ignored.  We sat in the bar area for lunch and had to ask the waitress (Crystal) if we could place an order.  Really??  I could have understood if they would have been busy but with only about 12 customers in the entire place, that wasn't the case.  Management really should re-train their employees to be polite and friendly to the customers.  I'll spend my money somewhere else in Auburndale from now on.

Lets start by saying that I like chilis and have been to this location many times. But the past two experiences were horrible. The service was terrible but the food was good. But lets go straight to the reason why I'm giving them one star. We ordered two appetizers and three entrees. Server looked like she hated her job and didnt want to be there. Zero personality. Food came and it was good until we were almost done and spotted a LIVE ROACH WALKING ON TOP OF ONE OF THE APPETIZERS. gross gross. Manager came and saw it. Apologized and took care of our bill. Not the point. This should never happen. Chili's lost a customer because of it.

Every year that we come down to this area, this is one of the places that we stop to eat at. It's close, convenient, and the service is pretty good. We usually go in with s large group but this time it was just me and my mother, hungry after a day at a local event. We sat at a booth in the bar area. Like Applebee's, they also have the table kiosks BUT you can only reorder drinks or order dessert from it. Games can also be played on them for a fee. You can pay from this device and it will print out a receipt too. We didn't use it this time.  We wanted the tableside guacamole where they mix the guacamole in front of you but our waitress said they were out so we got the regular order of guac. The chips that came with the chips and salsa were weak. The chips were thin so they broke when scooping and some were greasy. The salsa was very watery. The guac was just ok.  I ordered a simple Grilled Chicken Salad which was perfect and my mother got a Southwestern Trio consisting of a chicken quesadilla, chicken soft taco, and chicken enchilada. She said the enchilada was good but the soft taco was a disappointment. It just didn't have enough cheese for her. The quesadilla had shredded chicken and she wasn't a fan of that. We'd come back next year as we don't go to Chili's that often.

Came late at night with 8 people. Place was very crowded but didn't wait long for seating. Food was delicious and didnt take long to get. Waitress kept up on refills, however did not come and get empty/dirty dishes. Only negative was seeing servers eat behind the bar

The stars are for our server... I believe her name was Amber...  Lets start with we walked in and stood waiting to be seated for 5 minutes (the bar tables were all dirty) finally a hostess walks up and says "what are you looking for" seriously????  I told her a place to sit and she replied "well go in the bar... you can seat yourself ya know" Should have walked out right then!!! I told her the tables were dirty and she said well they'll clean them soon... then she walked away!!!!  Amber was pleasant and patient as we figured out what we wanted. She even made some nice suggestions. Our drinks stayed full the whole time we were there (which is HUGE in my book as I'm also a server) when we got our food she was very attentive to our needs.  The side of asparagus was flavorless and looked old...  But the fajitas were pretty good. I always order fajitas at chili's.  We didn't complain about the asparagus or anything while we were there... I chalk that disaster up to some food is just always better than others.  However because of the way we were "greeted" (if you can even call it that) we will probably not be going back to ANY chilis anytime in the future. I can't believe they allow people like that to keep their jobs.

I have given the place too many chances. Take out and eat in. My family and I have done take out 2times, both times the order was wrong, key items missing. After the first one I called them they offered something free for the next one, it was not worth it. We have ate in several times fodd is always ok but service times are nuts. Not trying again.

Ok. Where do I start... Well first when we sat down there was no utensils or napkins. Then  when we ordered appetizers they didn't offer chips and salsa, which are suppose to be free, and when we asked for them they wanted to charge us. Then we ordered the FRIED pickles, and when they came out 15 minutes later they weren't even fried. And I'm pretty sure they just used cucumbers, cause they didn't even taste like pickles. Then when we ordered our food we kept getting a lot of I don't knows and no we don't have that. When the menu clearly says you do! The waitress ignored us most of the time. Then every time I tried to ask for something They would just walk by, look at me and keep walking! Now when the food came out the ribs were cold, the chicken wasn't grilled and the macaroni wasn't the way it should be. So not only will we not be coming back here, others who read this shouldn't go either.

ZERO STARS... Friday at 5 pm.  We ordered and only after complaining did we receive our food OVER an HOUR LATER.  This is a bit excessive.  No apology from the waitress (Tiffany).  She acted like it was normal and didn't see a problem at all.  My first Skinny Patron Margarita was great.  The second was not drinkable.  My husband took it to the bar himself because otherwise it would have never gotten there and was told "I am the only bartender and if you don't like that one then you won't like the 2nd one either because I'm the only one making them."  So he returned with the same drink.  The manager, apparently, made me another drink (my husband saw the bartender make) and it was drinkable and as good as the first.  My son never got another apple juice that was asked for.  My other son's hamburger was ordered plain however it came with everything on it.  My bacon ranch chicken quesadillas looked like half of them had been deep fried.  There were not many people when we showed up at 5 and were told by the hostess that most of the staff doesn't get there until 5:30... An odd thing to say to customers.  When we left at 7 o'clock the line was out the door.  This must be why they don't really care.

I'm not much of a fan of the big chain restaurants.  I can't even tell you the last time I went to a Friday's, Applebee's, or Red Lobster, but I like Chili's.  I like the margaritas, the chips and salsa, and the enchilada soup.  These are the only things I order, but they all make me very happy.   I like to come and sit in the bar because margaritas are always 2 for 1 in the bar and you always get free chips and salsa in the bar and chips and salsa are one of my greatest vices in life.  I never know when to stop.   I'm very into soup.  I love a good soup and Chili's Chicken Enchilada Soup is one of my favorite soups anywhere.  I order it every time I go to Chili's.  If you've never had it, you should try it.  It is creamy, and cheesey with just a little bit of spice.  They sprinkle tortilla strips and cheese on top.  If you are still hungry for dessert might I recommend the skillet cookie.

I've given this location the benefit of the doubt far to many times. No matter if we have eaten there for lunch or dinner, in the bar, restaurant, or even take out... We have had numerous issues. I've had my order screwed up countless times; been brought the wrong order completely, been served food 15 mins before the rest of the table... I mean this list could go on and on. I understand that sometimes mistakes happen in the kitchen...But at this location they happen all to often. I doubt I will be returning again after tonight. I placed an order online around 8pm. The 2 for 20 deal- pasta and a burger. The site told me it would be ready at 8:30. So I got there at 8:30. The to-go server was very nice and explained they were just waiting on my pasta. TWENTY MINUTES later they finally have my order ready. So if they were waiting on the pasta did the make the rest and let it sit there the 20 minutes until it was ready? Cause let me tell you that's what it tastes like. Not only was the burger and cheese fries cold... But so was my "fresh" pasta. The server brought it out to me and said "careful, it's hot"  was he being sarcastic? Only living about 5-10 minutes away my food shouldn't have been anywhere near as cold as it was. Sadly this is the only option other than fast food on this side of town- I'll be making the drive next time we want to order take out.

Our waiter was rude. He literally threw down our silverware & rushed us to tell him our order. I work in a restaurant, so i get what its like, but i also know good customer service. We left him a low tip & i wish i would have written to tell him why he deserved such a low tip. He checked on us once & it was only him passing by. Decent food, it wasnt hot. Will NOT come back.

Wish I could give no stars. One hour from arrival to getting our food, food was sub-par. Manager was promised, but never showed. We paid full price for late, highly spiced cold food. Very interesting late food comes out cold?? I understand the bad reviews lately at this Chilis. Go to Winter Haven or Lakeland instead.
Horrible. The manager was the only redeeming factor. Can't tell you about the food since I was never asked. Employees at the bar drinking. Place is a joke.

I've been here about three times and it has been disappointing every time. Went there tonight with my parents, little brother and my wife. We got two orders of chips with salsa and almost all the chips were broken into small pieces. My parents and wife ordered soups. My wife and Fathers soup came but my mother's didn't come out until after they were already done with theirs. My father called the chili disgusting. I got the "triple dipper" for my meal. the fried pickles tasted terrible( I've had much better), the burger sliders were overcooked and dry, and the chicken crispers were burnt. it was so bad I didn't even eat most of it. my wife had ribs that tasted bad. she didn't like the Mac and cheese. even the BBQ sauce was bad. waitress asked if something was wrong and we told her I didn't like my food. all the manager did was give us fries to go. didn't even take anything off the bill, which was high. apparently a bottle of beer is $6 and the margaritas are like $12 and are mostly ice. normally don't complain about price, but they're definitely not worth that much. I definitely will suggest against going to chili's next time my parents want to have dinner out with us.

I'm only giving it a 1 star because you have to select at least 1!  My partner and I took our dinner break here and walked in at 1015pm and stood at the hostess booth for 8 minutes before someone even walked up and asked if we had been waited on. I said no then the girl walks away, returns 1 minute later only to say "I'm looking for a table for you guys" then walked away and never returned. 2 minutes later....we walked out!  Do not waste your time and money at an establishment that won't even take the time to greet you!!!!!   I will never be returning and will make sure to tell my buddies at work not to waste their time or money here.
The service is getting better, but the managers still have a rough road ahead of them with their servers. They are trying to cut down the wait time also.

So this is a Chili's, which we are all familiar with. This one is across the street from the Best Western and the Racetrac in Auburndale. We came here because we were in a somewhat unfamiliar place and were not feeling adventurous. It is times like these that a reliably clean place with familiar items comes in handy. I had the Margarita Grilled chicken which was good(as always), she had one of their new steaks topped with avocado and roasted tomato over asparagus(good, but much smaller than the picture), the kids had kids meals. What really stuck out was how great our waiter was. I'm terrible with names, but he was really friendly, attentive, and even entertained and joked with the kids. I would recommend this location if you're in the area looking for something reliable and not in the adventurous mood.

Let's keep this short like my visit here. Slow service, unfriendly staff, screwed up orders. This is the worst chili's I've ever been to. Unfortunately I went twice and it was the same experience both times. My bad!

Been a Loyal Chili's customer since the chains inception. Every site is totally different when it comes to quality of service. I would rate the CG Winter Haven store far superior than this Auburndale store. Managers at Adale store seem to not give a crap...period. Dont waste good money here...go to CG Store.

My Mother's Day dinner with my daughter and my niece and my son-in-law was absolutely horrible as my food was undercooked the servers never came the drinks were never refilled and the place was filthy to the point to where I wanted to up and leave but I was so overwhelmed with Hunger I took one bite of the food and then felt sick right after. the servers sat around doing nothing conversating and the manager himself was barely doing anything sitting around looking at the dirty tables that weren't cleaned or dealt with. I also need to point out the fact that there were people served before me with piping hot food& on my table was served with cold undercooked food my Mother's Day dinner has been horribly ruined and I will never be eating at that establishment ever again. I was not asked how I would like my burger cooked. Had to ask for clean forks and knives repetitively. I do not know who does the hiring for this particular chilis, but in my opinion in the restaurant service for over 18 years they need to be fired.

I went after school with a friend for an early dinner. The waitress was very friendly. My food was hot and it was an overall good experience. It probably helped that it wasn't busy yet. We left when it started getting crowded.
Cold onion rings. They did replace. Had the chicken fajita was just ok. Service was very slow. And they did not offer the free chips in the bar. Will not be back.

Hello fellow Yelpers! Here we go again with another quality review which I hope helps your decision if you're ever in the Auburndale, FL area. Let me paint this picture. We have a large 16 party table on an early Sunday afternoon. Everyone's is hungry and the adults are ready for the 2-for-1 frozen margarita special. However, we were told they "ran out" of frozen marg...what??!! That's when our suspicions were proven right, they're not truly frozen - must be pre-made mixers...not cool. We ordered margs on the rocks which were more rocks than margs. We then ordered another round and asked for less ice...guess what, we got less ice and the same amount of marg (pic included) Waitress told us the bartender is stingy... When our orders came, most seemed like we ordered from the kids menu. First and last...hope this helps.

This is probably the worst chilis I have ever been to owner doesn't deserve the place. The service is always slow the wait staff is always friendly it seems the owner is the real problem here doesn't know how to properly manage his business. I overheard a confrontation between him and another customer and I was disgusted

Absolutely terrible owner, AMAZED this guy is still in charge. He has his staff to thank and sadly never will. He is an arrogant, pompous, ridiculous man with a ferocious power trip and no sense of etiquette whatsoever. I won't return until this man is relieved of his burden of ownership. Awful. He tore down another customer and did not care who was listening and watching. My husband and I were made very uncomfortable. Patrons beware, you may get dinner and a show you weren't expecting. Just hope the spotlight isn't on you.

I wish I could give this place 0 stars! Probably the worst restaurant in Auburndale. Last few times I've ate there the food was cold, service was slow and no matter where you sit it's freezing. The very last time I went a huge roach crawled across our table and onto one of our plates of food. I had to kill the roach with a napkin and our waitress brushed it off & said "sorry bout that. I'll bring the manager over". The manager comes over &  first thing she says is "so how are we doing?" ??? How do you think I'm doing??? She acted like it was an everyday thing!! She asked what if we wanted something else, I told her "I'm just ready to leave" & she let us go without paying. Over the last 6 months the place has went down hill & is just disgusting. I have not and will not be back.

We have been to a few Chili Restaurants in other areas and wanted to check this one out.  Service was slow, only a few people in the restaurant and we had to wait five minutes to be seated. The food was not very good and it was Cold. I ordered the maragarita special for $5.00 but was charged the $8.99 regular price.  We expressed our concerns to the waiter, the manager came over to our table. He said he was sorry and hoped we would give him a second chance.  ABSOLUTELY NOT!
Not sure what happened! We waited 1 hour and a half for food that was cod, hard and unappealing. The manager said, "sorry" and that was it. Won't come here ahain!! Horrible!!

The staff nice and friendly, service was fast, drinks  testy the only problem we had was the food.  My wife and I ordered BBQ Ribs the quality of the racks terrible over cook but the  and the fries was good
Absolutely worse service  at a Chili's restaurant ever.  Very long wait.  Simply stated, don't go here!

Unbelievably bad from the beginning. After just over 5 minutes of waiting before we saw someone emerge on the floor, we were seated.  After we were seated another 12 minutes passed before we seen a waitress.  We told her we were ready to order and showed an email I had gotten earlier in the day from Chili's. She said that's the first she saw that one. Over 5 minutes later she came back and asked to see my email on my phone again. She walked away with it saying while she's walking, "I'm showing this to my manager."  After a couple of minutes she returned because I was getting a phone call. That's a BIG no-no taking someone's phone with my information on it. Then finally the manager shows up to tell us they won't honor it. We complained about the 30 minutes of events leading up to this and he smarted off and tried to side step the taking of my phone issue.  Rather than any real explanation he simple decided to embarrass us with tables full surrounding us, and said they weren't honoring it.  I guess I should have read the reviews before going.  One star is an above average rating. The last time I was at this location I had to sit through fowl language discussions coming from the kitchen. Never again.

After waiting 7 minutes to be seated we finally got to our table. Then after 10 minutes we finally had a waitress come to our table. Then 10 more minutes went by to get orders and the drinks themselves. A few more minutes went by to hear that the promotion email we got doesn't work at this Chilis. Very bad service and rude management. Doubt I'll ever come back here again.

This has got to be the worst chili's restaurant.  I go to Chili's all the time, never again. Worst service , management , and food. Dried out food, fajitas?  guess you cut them yourself.  Ribs were dry rubbed! Beef jerry style. Never again
I've been here 2 times, and both times I've been here I've gotten food poisoning from their burgers which I asked for well done. Now if I go here, I only get their chips with guacamole and salsa.

We came in and all the tables were dirty. We were told they were cleaning one which the one they supposedly was cleaning was pointed out to us, we waited ten minutes then two people came out and cleaned a totally different table. They acted as though we were inconveniencing them to come eat there when it's a restaurant. The food was overcooked to the point I didn't eat mine and my husband ate about half of his. Which we actually wondered after how old it was because we both ended up with upset stomachs.  Never have we ever had this bad of an experience here.
